greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: strictly decreasing sequences of nonnegative numbers given in lexicographic order.
comment: Length of n-th row given by A000120(n);
Maximum of n-th row given by A000523(n);
Minimum of n-th row given by A007814(n);
GCD of n-th row given by A064894(n);
Sum of n-th row given by A073642(n + 1).
n-th row begins at index A000788(n - 1) for n > 0.
The first appearance of n is at A001787(n).
Row n < 1024 lists the digits of A262557(n). - _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 11 2019
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: Row n is given by the exponents in the binary expansion of n. For example, row 5 = [2, 0] because 5 = 2^2 + 2^0.
program: (PARI) apply( A272011_row(n)=Vecrev(vecextract([0..exponent(n+!n)],n)), [0..39]) \\ For n < 2^10: row(n)=digits(A262557[n]). There are 2^k rows starting with k, they start at row 2^k. - _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 11 2019
xref: Cf. A133457 gives the rows in reverse order.
results.author: _Peter Kagey_, Apr 17 2016
